Header.Info: Performance Monitoring Events for 11th Generation Intel(R) Core(TM) Processor - V1.19

Events.BriefDescription: Total number of all outgoing entries allocated. Accounts for Coherent and non-coherent traffic.
Events.PublicDescription: Total number of all outgoing entries allocated. Accounts for Coherent and non-coherent traffic.

Events.BriefDescription: Number of entries allocated. Account for Any type: e.g. Snoop,  etc.
Events.PublicDescription: Number of entries allocated. Account for Any type: e.g. Snoop,  etc.

Events.BriefDescription: This 48-bit fixed counter counts the UCLK cycles.
Events.PublicDescription: This 48-bit fixed counter counts the UCLK cycles.

Events.BriefDescription: Counts every 64B read and write request entering the Memory Controller to DRAM (sum of all channels). Each write request counts as a new request incrementing this counter. However, same cache line write requests (both full and partial) are combined to a single 64 byte data transfer to DRAM.
Events.PublicDescription: Counts every 64B read and write request entering the Memory Controller to DRAM (sum of all channels). Each write request counts as a new request incrementing this counter. However, same cache line write requests (both full and partial) are combined to a single 64 byte data transfer to DRAM.

Events.BriefDescription: Counts every read (RdCAS) issued by the Memory Controller to DRAM (sum of all channels). All requests result in 64 byte data transfers from DRAM.
Events.PublicDescription: Counts every read (RdCAS) issued by the Memory Controller to DRAM (sum of all channels). All requests result in 64 byte data transfers from DRAM.

Events.BriefDescription: Counts every write (WrCAS) issued by the Memory Controller to DRAM (sum of all channels). All requests result in 64 byte data transfers from DRAM.
Events.PublicDescription: Counts every write (WrCAS) issued by the Memory Controller to DRAM (sum of all channels). All requests result in 64 byte data transfers from DRAM.

Events.BriefDescription: Counts every 64B read and write request entering the Memory Controller to DRAM (sum of all channels). Each write request counts as a new request incrementing this counter. However, same cache line write requests (both full and partial) are combined to a single 64 byte data transfer to DRAM.
Events.PublicDescription: Counts every 64B read and write request entering the Memory Controller to DRAM (sum of all channels). Each write request counts as a new request incrementing this counter. However, same cache line write requests (both full and partial) are combined to a single 64 byte data transfer to DRAM.

Events.BriefDescription: Counts every read (RdCAS) issued by the Memory Controller to DRAM (sum of all channels). All requests result in 64 byte data transfers from DRAM.
Events.PublicDescription: Counts every read (RdCAS) issued by the Memory Controller to DRAM (sum of all channels). All requests result in 64 byte data transfers from DRAM.

Events.BriefDescription: Counts every write (WrCAS) issued by the Memory Controller to DRAM (sum of all channels). All requests result in 64 byte data transfers from DRAM.
Events.PublicDescription: Counts every write (WrCAS) issued by the Memory Controller to DRAM (sum of all channels). All requests result in 64 byte data transfers from DRAM.

Events.BriefDescription: Each cycle count number of all outgoing valid entries in ReqTrk. Such entry is defined as valid from it's allocation in ReqTrk till deallocation. Accounts for Coherent and non-coherent traffic.
Events.PublicDescription: Each cycle count number of all outgoing valid entries in ReqTrk. Such entry is defined as valid from it's allocation in ReqTrk till deallocation. Accounts for Coherent and non-coherent traffic.
